column2: NEW YORK PERMIT TEST
column4: New York

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. The yield sign means:
column4: You must come to a complete stop.
column6: The traffic light will soon be red.
column8: Slow down and give vehicles crossing your path the right-of-way.
column10: Drive with caution in wet weather.

column2: 2. Is chemical test evidence required to prove you were driving while impaired or intoxicated?
column4: Yes, and a BAC test is also required.
column6: No. The testimony of a police officer about the way you drive, your behavior when arrested is enough.
column10: No, but a breath or blood test is required.

column2: 3. If you are in a crash you must:
column4: stop.
column6: leave the scene if the crash involves only property damage.
column8: stop, unless the incident involves a fatality.

column2: 4. If a traffic officer signals you to drive through a red light:
column4: you must not obey the officer. Signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.
column8: you must wait for the red light to turn green.

column2: 5. Which of the following is true about the Anti-Locking Brake System?
column4: Can help improve vehicle stability.
column8: It allows drivers to steer during an emergency braking situation.

column2: 6. On what three conditions does your blood alcohol content (BAC) depend?
column4: Your weight. How much alcohol you drink. How much time passes between drinks.
column6: How fit you are. How much alcohol you drink. Your height.
column8: Your weight. The type of beverage you drink. How fit you are.
column10: Your height. How much alcohol you drink. The type of beverage you drink.

column2: 7. The BAC standards and penalties for commercial drivers are:
column4: not applied to truck drivers with 20+ years driving experience.

column2: 8. A flashing red light:
column4: means the same thing as a stop sign.
column6: means that you must bring your vehicle to a complete halt.

column2: 9. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.
column6: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.
column8: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.

column2: 10. When driving at night, you should:
column4: make sure your windshield is clean.
column6: keep the interior roof light off.

column2: 11. ABS is the acronym for:
column4: Average-Beam System

column2: 12. This sign indicates:
column4: Winding road

column2: 13. You are convicted of Driving While Ability Impaired as a first offense. Which of the following potential consequences do you face?
column4: up to 15 days in jail.

column2: 14. You hear an emergency vehicle heading toward your vehicle. What do you do?
column4: After stopping, wait until the emergency vehicle passes before you drive on.
column6: If you are in an intersection, drive out of it before you pull over.
column8: Pull over immediately to the right and stop.

column2: 15. The picture shows:
column4: a crossing

column2: 16. At a railroad crossing, you must stop at least 15 feet from the tracks if you see/hear:
column4: lowered crossing gates.

column2: 17. A steady yellow light means:
column4: Be prepared to go. The light will soon be green.
column6: Be prepared to stop for the red light.
column8: Stop, yield the right-of-way, and go.

column2: 18. A thumping sound can be a warning:
column4: of a brake failure.
column6: that a tire blowout is about to occur.

column2: 19. If you are involved in a crash, you must:
column4: Take pictures and post them on Facebook and other social media sites.
column10: It depends on the level of damage.

column2: 20. Regulation signs normallyÂ are ____ rectangles with ____ letters or symbols.
column4: yellow; black
